programmes.show_description: (2021) Poignant sci-fi romantic comedy with Maren Eggert and Dan Stevens. In near-future Berlin, a lonely archaeologist helps to trial a new line in robot companions. In German/subs.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
(1943) Second World War drama starring Tyrone Power and Anne Baxter. An ambitious naval officer falls in love with a school teacher before leaving on a dangerous submarine mission.
(1949) World War II drama starring Gregory Peck as a US general who must treat a demoralised bomber squadron severely to restore discipline. With Oscar-winning support from Dean Jagger.
Director Quentin Tarantino and stars Samuel L Jackson, Christoph Waltz, Jamie Foxx and Kerry Washington talk about making the western adventure set against a backdrop of slavery.
(1995) Romantic drama based on Arthurian legend, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery and Julia Ormond. Can nomadic swordsman Lancelot contain his love for King Arthur's fianc√©e?
...Interview Special: Stars Chris Hemsworth and Tessa Thompson, director F Gary Gray and producers Walter Parkes and Laurie Macdonald talk about bringing the series back for a fourth part.
(2019) Fourth instalment of the sci-fi comedy franchise with Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Liam Neeson. An alien-obsessed rookie joins London's Men in Black team.
(2023) Matt Johnson, Glenn Howerton and Jay Baruchel star in the frenetic, flabbergasting and mostly true story of the precipitous rise and fall of the once ubiquitous device.
(2019) Keanu Reeves returns for the third time as the supposedly retired hitman. Someone's put a contract on John Wick's head and only a mystic in Morocco can lift it.
(2018) Paddy Considine and Jodie Whittaker star in Considine's sobering drama about a boxer who wins his world championship bout, only to be left with a serious head injury. Violence.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
(1957) Offbeat melodrama starring Richard Burton (as an RAF officer), Joan Collins (as a nun), Basil Sydney and Cy Grant, who end up on a life raft together after their ship is torpedoed.
(1940) Swashbuckling action-adventure starring Tyrone Power. An aristocrat dons his mask and cape to fight for the rights of the poor in 19th-century California. With Basil Rathbone.
(1942) Ginger Rogers stars in this comedy of romantic misadventure. A woman poses as a girl to get a cheap rail fare. But things get awkward when she falls for a man who helps her out.
(1939) John Ford western with Henry Fonda and Claudette Colbert. In 1776, a settler and his wife attempt to farm in the Mohawk Valley but face attacks from Native Americans and the English.
(2015) Drama exploring the increasingly defiant campaign by British women for equality and the right to vote in the years before WWI. Starring Carey Mulligan and Meryl Streep.
(2022) Michael Bay's high-octane thriller with Jake Gyllenhaal. After a bodged heist, two brothers try to evade the LAPD in an ambulance, while a paramedic operates on a cop in the back.
(2020) Groundhog day shoot 'em up with Frank Grillo, Naomi Watts and Mel Gibson. Ray gets killed every day. Can he escape by unravelling the mystery of why a bunch of people want him dead?
